channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Thomson Reuters CEO: With changes to U.S. policy likely, here’s what to expect for AI in business and government
item.description: Sitting out a tech revolution is simply not an option, writes Thomson Reuters CEO Steve Hasker.

item.title: The Rise of Advocacy Economics
item.description: Americans deserve to be informed by economic assessments that are built on logic and evidence, not on advocacy.

item.title: John Fetterman Defends Democrats Counting Invalid Ballots In PA Senate Race
item.description: Democrats' only concern is denying Republicans an electoral victory, no matter how fraudulent the methods.

item.title: The New York Times Fact-Checks Itself In Fumbled Fact Check Of RFK Froot Loops Claims

item.title: Exclusive: Menopause startup Alloy raises $16 million
item.description: Monica Molenaar and Anne Fulenwider cofounded Alloy four years ago.

item.title: Spending bill trouble brews as Sen Mike Lee warns of Christmas 'swampbus'
item.description: Republican Sen. Mike Lee is urging Americans to pressure their senators and representatives to oppose a pre-Christmas omnibus bill.

item.title: It’s Time for an Authentic Human-Rights Agenda at the State Department
item.description: The U.S. can reclaim its role as a principled leader, one that upholds true human dignity and is grounded in respect for life, family, and freedom.
